Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CompileToDalvikWithDx should provide deps / --classpath_entry(s) while desugaring" (#2143) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Build an app project with some _binding library_

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

desugar_deploy.jar desugaring _.jar_ with dependencies without exception

### Actual Behavior

**CompileToDalvikWithDx** entirely skips the _--classpath_entry_  dependencies for _.jar_ (or it's by design? please no) when desugar_deploy.jar  gets called, causing failures just like:

`1>  Exception in thread "main" java.lang.TypeNotPresentException: Type okhttp3.Interceptor not present`

### Version Information

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

xa sdk 9.1.0.19

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android binding project reference shows unresolved namespaces/types" (#2142) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When referencing an Android binding library project from an Android app in the same application, the namespaces and types from the binding library show as unresolved if referencing the project directly. If instead the binding library assembly (.dll) is referenced instead of the project, namespaces and types correctly resolve. So basically intellisense is not working when referencing the binding project, but it works if you reference the assembly directly. The project will build and work as expected.

This only occurs in Visual Studio 2017. Issues does not occur in Visual Studio for Mac. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the AarBinding example project from here: https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/monodroid/JavaIntegration/AarBinding/
2. Open the solution in VS 2017 (version info below)
3. Open the MainActivity.cs file in the BindingTest project

### Expected Behavior
Namespaces and types from the AarBinding project will be resolved

### Actual Behavior
Namespaces and types form the AarBinding project are not resolved. They are underlined in red with message "The type or namespace 'x' could not be found. Are you missing an assembly reference?"


[AarBinding.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2350869/AarBinding.zip)


### Version Information

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Crashlytics for Android generates conflicting provider" (#2141) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @deckerst on September 4, 2018 6:54_

Crashlytics aar manifest relies on `${applicationId}` for its providers. One of them is misinterpreted and replaced by `dollar_openBracket_applicationId_closeBracket` in the final app manifest:
```
        <provider
            android:name="com.crashlytics.android.CrashlyticsInitProvider"
            android:exported="false"
            android:authorities="bpu.aimei.crashlyticsinitprovider"
            android:initOrder="100" />

        <provider
            android:name="com.crashlytics.android.CrashlyticsInitProvider"
            android:exported="false"
            android:authorities="dollar_openBracket_applicationId_closeBracket"
            android:initOrder="100" />
```

As this is a static string it is not unique to the app, so it conflicts with any other app that also uses Crashlytics. Installation of the second app will then fail with `INSTALL_FAILED_CONFLICTING_PROVIDER`. This is a blocker for us as we developed several Xamarin apps and we urgently need to replace Firebase Crash Reporting by Crashlytics in all of them.


_Copied from original issue: xamarin/XamarinComponents#444_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] leave classes.zip uncompressed" (#2140) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I was thinking about a couple of the slower MSBuild tasks:
- `Javac`
- `CompileToDalvik`

One thing I noticed here was that `Javac` outputs a `classes.zip`
file, and `CompileToDalvik` consumes it. It also looked like we are
using `CompressionMethod.Default` as you would expect.

So why should we compress this file at all? It seemed that was work we
could just skip and things would work fine? Presumably `dx.jar` can
work with an uncompressed `classes.zip` file faster than a compressed
one?

So I made the following changes:
- Added an option to pass in the `CompressionMethod` in `ZipArchiveEx`
- Used `CompressionMethod.Store` for creating `classes.zip`

The results on a File | New Xamarin.Forms app looked great!

Before:

     3443 ms  Javac                                      1 calls
    11545 ms  CompileToDalvik                            1 calls

After:

     3338 ms  Javac                                      1 calls
    10535 ms  CompileToDalvik                            1 calls

I did a `Clean` before running the `SignAndroidPackage` target on
these builds.

These savings seem pretty good! The only drawback being we use more
disk space in `$(IntermediateOutputPath)`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Running Android App to AVD fails with "error ADB0000: Value cannot be null" using XA 9.1.0.12" (#2095) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an Android App using VSMac
2. Select Android_Accelerated_Nougat (API 25) AVD
3. Build and Deploy the project

[Repro Bundle](http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/TestAndroidInspectIconEnabledWithEnterprise-Bundle-1a5da2a0179c4e33ac664f5563e81925.zip)

### Expected Behavior

The project is deployed successfully

### Actual Behavior

The project fails to deploy to AVD with error

```
error ADB0000: Value cannot be null.
error ADB0000: Parameter name: path2
error ADB0000:   at System.IO.Path.Combine (System.String path1, System.String path2, System.String path3) [0x0002a] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/build-package-osx-mono/2018-06/external/bockbuild/builds/mono-x64/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/Path.cs:849 
error ADB0000:   at Xamarin.AndroidTools.PlatformPackage.GetVersionInfo (System.String frameworkVersion) [0x0000a] in :0 
error ADB0000:   at Xamarin.AndroidTools.PlatformPackage.GetPlatformPackageVersion (System.Int32 apiLevel, System.String& packageName) [0x00040] in :0 
error ADB0000:   at AndroidDeviceExtensions.GetPackageVersionsAsync (Mono.AndroidTools.AndroidDevice device, System.Int32 packageApiLevel, System.String packageName, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) [0x0001f] in :0 
error ADB0000:   at AndroidDeviceExtensions.GetPackagesAsync (Mono.AndroidTools.AndroidDevice device, System.Int32 packageApiLevel, System.String packageName, System.Boolean provideFullDebugRuntime, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken, Xamarin.AndroidTools.IProgressNotifier progressReporter) [0x001cc] in :0 
error ADB0000:   at Xamarin.AndroidTools.AndroidDeploySession.RunAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken token) [0x001c4] in :0 
error ADB0000:   at Xamarin.AndroidTools.AndroidDeploySession.RunLoggedAsync (System.Threading.CancellationToken token) [0x00077] in :0 
```

[Full `Deploying To Device` pad content of VS for Mac](http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/DeployingToDeviceOutput-12e5621b30f3450ba2b86135fbc4dab0.txt)

### Version Information

[About VS for Mac](http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/log-4368ea1d5f8643cb834671bef8b0dc72.txt)

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] Swapping MainPage from MasterDetailPage causes crash in Control Gallery" (#3705) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Swapping MainPage from MasterDetailPage causes crash in Control Gallery. Not sure yet if this is a problem with Control Gallery or larger.

```
09-04 20:19:31.257 I/MonoDroid(14996): System.NotSupportedException: Unable to activate instance of type Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.NativeDroidMasterDetail from native handle 0x75 (key_handle 0xc1eb5bf). ---> System.MissingMethodException: No constructor found for Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.NativeDroidMasterDetail::.ctor(System.IntPtr, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership) ---> Java.Interop.JavaLocationException: Exception of type 'Java.Interop.JavaLocationException' was thrown.
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):    --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Interop.TypeManager.CreateProxy (System.Type type, System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) [0x00055] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Interop.TypeManager.CreateInstance (System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer, System.Type targetType) [0x00116] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):    --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Interop.TypeManager.CreateInstance (System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer, System.Type targetType) [0x00182] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Lang.Object.GetObject (System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer, System.Type type) [0x000c1] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Lang.Object._GetObject[T] (System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) [0x00017] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Java.Lang.Object.GetObject[T] (System.IntPtr handle, Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) [0x00000] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Android.Views.ViewGroup.GetChildAt (System.Int32 index) [0x00036] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.AppCompat.Platform.Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.IPlatformLayout.OnLayout (System.Boolean changed, System.Int32 l, System.Int32 t, System.Int32 r, System.Int32 b) [0x00045] in D:\Source-Xamarin\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android\AppCompat\Platform.cs:221 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.PlatformRenderer.OnLayout (System.Boolean changed, System.Int32 l, System.Int32 t, System.Int32 r, System.Int32 b) [0x00010] in D:\Source-Xamarin\Xamarin.Forms\Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android\PlatformRenderer.cs:73 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at Android.Views.ViewGroup.n_OnLayout_ZIIII (System.IntPtr jnienv, System.IntPtr native__this, System.Boolean changed, System.Int32 l, System.Int32 t, System.Int32 r, System.Int32 b) [0x00009] in <287c23d84b25403d90bd533f61cbfb8d>:0 
09-04 20:19:31.258 I/MonoDroid(14996):   at (wrapper dynamic-method) System.Object.47(intptr,intptr,bool,int,int,int,int)
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Control Gallery
2. Click `Swap Root - TabbedPage` (or any other page type)

### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7827070/45063587-871ee580-b063-11e8-8a54-e640c7db61cd.png)

- Affected Devices:

See above

### Reproduction Link

Control Gallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] IsClippedToBounds does not work correctly on API < 18" (#3704) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
setClipBounds is currently only supported on API >= 18

In order to make it work on API < 18 in the same way that it works for >= 18 we would need to modify the ViewGroup and implement our own custom override to setClipBounds

For example
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18724976/can-setclipbounds-be-called-on-a-view-before-it-has-been-drawn

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Run MultipleClipToBounds in Control Gallery on a device with API < 18
2. Notice how the described tests fail

### Expected Behavior
Tests shouldn't fail

### Actual Behavior
Tests do fail

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "NavigationPage.PopAsync() cause memory leak by still holding on popped Page" (#1429) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Migrated from https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=31171

### Description
Found with profiler that Task<Page> holds popped Page from the CurrentNavigationTask property of NavigationPage. 

Potential PR was closed and not merged. https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/625

### Steps to Reproduce
Simple test case:
1) get start with Page1
2) navigate to Page2,
3) get back to Page1 with PopAsync() or back button.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 1.4.3

### Reproduction Link


[XamarinFormsBugs.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1573715/XamarinFormsBugs.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] Nested Listview not updating when using DataTemplateSelectors to swap out views" (#3703) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

ListView
-DatatemplateSelector
--Listview


### Steps to Reproduce
1. Run Control Gallery for Issue3408
2. Click Change Source
3. Click Change Property
4. Click Change Source
5. Click Change Property

You'll notice the views stop updating.
Running this sample on UWP you can see it keeps swapping out the view successfully


### Expected Behavior
The content of the listview should keep updating

### Actual Behavior
The content stops updating

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1
- Last known good version: Not Sure

### Reproduction Link

Issue3408 in Control Gallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin.Forms view is freezing when appearing" (#3702) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

On some devices, app is freezing and memory is increasing indefintely. We have no information, no error log, just garbage collector logs which says memory is increasing

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use latest builds of Xamarin.Forms (3.1.0.637273 and 3.1.0.697729)
2. View contain tabbed page, listview, "PullToRefresh" widget from Syncfusion, and Floating Action Button from FAB.Forms (dependencies updated manually)
3. App launch, with a login view, and when logged and main view is appearing, app is freezing.

### Expected Behavior

App navigation

### Actual Behavior

App frozen

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1.0.637273 and 3.1.0.697729
- Last known good version: 3.1.0.583944
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: Android API 27 (Tested and reproduced on API 24 and 26)
- Android Support Library Version: v7
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy A6 (2016) and Samsung Galaxy S9 Plus

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Android] Is FastRenderers_Experimental still needed?" (#3696) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,

Version 3.1 was working fine. 

Here is an updated file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[imageio] Fix breaking change for 'ExifCFAPattern' field" (#4746) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened pull request "mono-2018-08: use coop transitions for monomac" (#4750) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
With `2018-08` (nee 5.18) Mono uses hybrid suspend by default.

Hybrid suspend use cooperative suspend for threads that are running managed code or native Mono runtime code (or other code such as XamMac code marked with GC Unsafe regions) and preemptive suspend for threads that are running other code (such as P/Invokes, blocking system calls, and other code marked by GC Safe regions).

Every mono API function called from XM (listed in the `runtime/exports.t4` file) has been wrapped inside to perform GC Unsafe transitions when called.

This PR changes XM to use the coop attach/detach functions.  If hybrid suspend is being used, these will ensure that when threads detach they will be left in GC Safe mode.  (If preemptive suspend is used, the coop attach/detach just amount to the same thing as the JIT attach functions from before).

Also bump the required minimum system mono version for running XM apps to 5.18.0.68.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "iOS cannot save Entity models with Nullable Guid (Guid?) property types (among others) using EF Core 2.1.2." (#4749) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download, extract, and load the sample solution in Visual Studio 15.8.1.
[iOSEFCore212.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/2350303/iOSEFCore212.zip)

2. Build and run the project, targeting a physical iPhone device.

**PLEASE NOTE:** This project has been adapted from the sample provided by @cwrea for a preceding issue described [here](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4168).

### Expected Behavior
The project should build and run, writing some lines to debug output indicating that Entity Framework Core has created a database from the simple model included in the project, saved a few test records, and retrieved them.

### Actual Behavior
The following exception is encountered when AddAsync() is called against the DbSet<T>:

`
System.ExecutionEngineException: Attempting to JIT compile method '(wrapper runtime-invoke) <Module>:runtime_invoke_void__this___int_byte_object_object_DateTime_Nullable1<DateTime>_Decimal_Guid_Nullable1<Guid>_Nullable1<int> (object,intptr,intptr,intptr)' while running in aot-only mode. See https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/ios/advanced_topics/limitations/ for more information.
 occurred
`

If the model (TodoItem.cs) does not contain a property of type Guid?, the project works without issue. Note that DateTime?, int?, and bool? property types work, but a similar error will be encountered for the decimal? type. I have not tested any additional nullable types at this time.

### Environment

1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
